reviews.subject: Computer Science
reviews.review: Dr. Johnson is an amazing professor! She is extremely knowledgeable and passionate about the subject matter. Her lectures are engaging and she is always willing to help students during office hours. Highly recommend this course.

reviews.subject: Economics
reviews.review: Professor Lee is a fair and reasonable instructor. His lectures can be dry at times, but he is very clear in explaining complex economic concepts. The workload is manageable, and he is accessible during office hours.

reviews.subject: Biology
reviews.review: Dr. Chen is an exceptional professor. Her lectures are well-organized and she uses a variety of teaching methods to ensure students understand the material. She is also very responsive to student questions and concerns.

reviews.subject: History
reviews.review: Professor Gonzalez is a knowledgeable instructor, but his teaching style can be a bit dry at times. The coursework is fair, and he is willing to work with students who are struggling. Overall, a solid professor.

reviews.subject: Psychology
reviews.review: Dr. Patel is a passionate and engaging professor. Her lectures are thought-provoking and she encourages students to participate in class discussions. She is also very accessible and provides helpful feedback on assignments.

reviews.subject: Mathematics
reviews.review: Professor Smith has a deep understanding of the subject matter and is able to explain complex concepts clearly. His lectures are well-structured and he provides ample opportunities for students to ask questions and participate.

reviews.subject: Political Science
reviews.review: Dr. Nguyen is an outstanding professor. She is knowledgeable, organized, and passionate about the material. Her lectures are engaging and she encourages critical thinking. I highly recommend taking her courses.

reviews.subject: Engineering
reviews.review: While Professor Martinez is knowledgeable in his field, his teaching style can be dry and his expectations for coursework can be unreasonable at times. The material is challenging, but he is willing to work with students who put in the effort.

reviews.subject: Sociology
reviews.review: Dr. Malik is a thoughtful and engaging professor. Her lectures are thought-provoking and she encourages class discussions. She is also very accessible and provides detailed feedback on assignments. I learned a lot in her course.

reviews.subject: Business
reviews.review: Professor Khalil is a knowledgeable and experienced instructor. His lectures are informative and he provides practical examples to illustrate key concepts. The workload is manageable, and he is responsive to student questions and concerns.

reviews.subject: Art History
reviews.review: Dr. Rossi is an exceptional professor. Her passion for the subject matter is contagious, and she has a remarkable ability to make complex topics accessible and engaging. Her lectures are visually stunning, and she encourages students to think critically about the material.

reviews.review: Professor Green provides clear and concise explanations of complex economic theories. His lectures are well-structured, and he encourages class participation. However, the course load can be heavy at times.

reviews.review: Dr. Davis is a brilliant professor with a passion for biology. She presents the material in a way that is easy to understand, and her labs are well-organized and highly educational. She is always available to help students.

reviews.subject: History
reviews.review: Professor Brown is knowledgeable, but his lectures can be monotonous at times. The material is interesting, but he could benefit from incorporating more interactive elements into his teaching.

reviews.subject: Psychology
reviews.review: Dr. Williams is a dedicated professor who is deeply committed to her students' success. Her lectures are insightful, and she fosters a collaborative learning environment. The only downside is that the exams can be quite challenging.

reviews.subject: Mathematics
reviews.review: Professor Wilson is a great teacher who makes complex math concepts accessible to students. He uses real-world examples to illustrate abstract ideas, making them easier to grasp. However, the pace of the class can be fast.

reviews.subject: Political Science
reviews.review: Dr. Lee is an inspiring professor who brings political science to life. Her lectures are thought-provoking, and she encourages students to engage in meaningful discussions. She is always available for one-on-one help.

reviews.subject: Engineering
reviews.review: Professor White is knowledgeable, but his teaching style can be a bit dry. The course material is challenging, and he expects a lot from his students. However, he is willing to provide extra help if needed.

reviews.review: Dr. Adams is an engaging professor who encourages students to think critically about societal issues. Her lectures are well-organized, and she creates a supportive environment for class discussions. The reading load can be heavy, though.

reviews.review: Professor Johnson is a highly experienced instructor who brings real-world examples into his lectures. His classes are practical and informative, but the workload can be intense, especially during midterms.

reviews.review: Dr. Taylor is an outstanding art history professor. Her lectures are visually stunning, and she has a unique ability to make the subject matter come alive. She is passionate about art and encourages students to explore their creativity.

reviews.review: Professor King is a dedicated teacher who makes physics accessible to all students. He uses demonstrations to explain complex concepts, and he is always willing to help students during office hours. The exams can be tough, though.

reviews.review: Dr. Johnson is an excellent language instructor who makes learning Italian fun and interactive. Her classes are well-structured, and she provides plenty of opportunities for practice. She is very supportive of her students.

reviews.subject: Computer Engineering
reviews.review: Professor Thomas is knowledgeable, but his teaching style can be a bit rigid. The coursework is challenging, and he expects students to be self-motivated. He is available for help, but students need to be proactive in seeking it.

reviews.subject: Environmental Science
reviews.review: Dr. Martinez is passionate about environmental science, and her enthusiasm is contagious. Her lectures are informative, and she encourages students to think critically about environmental issues. The class involves a lot of group work, which can be both good and bad.

reviews.subject: Finance
reviews.review: Professor Rivera is a knowledgeable finance instructor who explains complex concepts clearly. His lectures are practical, and he provides real-world examples to illustrate key points. The course is challenging, but manageable with effort.

reviews.subject: Neuroscience
reviews.review: Dr. Parker is a brilliant neuroscience professor. Her lectures are detailed and informative, and she has a knack for explaining complex topics in a way that is easy to understand. She is very supportive of her students.

reviews.subject: Civil Engineering
reviews.review: Professor Carter is knowledgeable, but his lectures can be a bit dry. The material is difficult, and he expects a lot from his students. However, he is willing to help those who put in the effort.

reviews.subject: Linguistics
reviews.review: Dr. Hughes is a passionate and engaging linguistics professor. Her lectures are thought-provoking, and she encourages students to participate in discussions. The coursework is challenging, but she provides helpful feedback.

reviews.subject: Spanish Language
reviews.review: Professor Wright is an exceptional Spanish instructor. His classes are immersive and interactive, and he creates a supportive environment for learning. He is patient, encouraging, and genuinely cares about his students' progress.

reviews.subject: Biochemistry
reviews.review: Dr. Lee is a knowledgeable and organized biochemistry professor. Her lectures are clear and concise, and she provides ample opportunities for students to ask questions. The exams are difficult, but she offers plenty of resources for success.

reviews.subject: CSCI316
reviews.review: unorganized and dropped a lot the last 2 weeks. canceled our 2nd test and made our final longer; gave us a project that she said she would break up (and didn't). assigned another portion of the final because it would take too long (took me 3 hours). Then she didn't even grade the project and gave us grades. goes on tangents, and lectures are boring

reviews.subject: CS211
reviews.review: SPRING 2024: The midterm was straightforward, with many getting 100+. The final was harder, yet still doable and both midterm and final were curved with a godly curve of sqrt*10. Thus, it is effectively impossible to fail the course, if you give even half effort. Free projects, Waxman will spoonfeed code. Pay attention and take good notes for exam.

reviews.subject: Computer Science
reviews.review: She is a very good explainer. She'll try her best to make you understand the topic you're unable to. She records her class and shares it online with classsnotes included. If you review and pratice enough you should be able to get a good grade.

reviews.subject: CS340
reviews.review: Make sure you listen a LOT to what professor says in class. She will test you heavily on what she goes over more frequently in class. Then, read the textbook chapter of the specific topic you went over in class. Go to office hours and ask specific questions on what to go over before a test, and go over topics you struggle with in office hours.

reviews.subject: CS340
reviews.review: cuny should be doing quality check of professors, she does not know out of the other than what she has taught, and i get lost from where she is teaching boring, jumping every context, self study does not work with her. the most bizzare thing is you can get easily get out of focus what she is teaching in class.

reviews.subject: CS340
reviews.review: While she does go on tangents a lot, it usually relates to the material. You will likely have to learn from the textbook though. Her exams are definitely not too hard if you put in the work. She can be kind of harsh grading the programming assignments though. She is generally nice but can be a bit mean if the class didnt do well on the exam.

reviews.subject: CSXXX
reviews.review: Professor Anne was ok, I didnt really learn much and she never showed up to class however she is very nice and even though I failed half the quizzes hard, she told us what would be on the final and the final itself was a copy paste of the quizzes with a curve and I got a 95 on the final somehow. I ended up with a B, Easy to pass but wont learn.

reviews.subject: CSCI316
reviews.review: Prof. Anne may take weeks and wait last minute to grade assignments but overall she teaches a lot of demanding classes and does a good job at going over lectures. While she tends to cancel classes a lot causing some memory retention issues she does give a decent review and clear exam topics to study.

reviews.subject: CSXXX
reviews.review: Prof. Smith is kind, caring, fair, responds quickly to emails, and teaches well. Make sure you're comfortable with Java if taking 313 (review labs & old projects). If you show up to class, PARTICIPATE, do all assignments, and study, you'll pass. Grade consisted of quizzes, 3 part Java project, final, and zybooks hw.

reviews.subject: CSXXX
reviews.review: Anne does go off topic but not as frequently as many say. Class is very chaotic and she'll frequently cancel class at the last minute. Takes FOREVER to post grades for anything. Doesn't respond to emails and generally seems very apathetic towards the class. Perfect representation of the CS department for a joke of an institution like QC.

reviews.subject: CS340
reviews.review: HORRIBLE. Took her for 343 last semester and now taking her for 340. Exams are not fair. Her lectures just consist of her going over zybooks and telling useless stories. Good luck to anyone taking her in the future.

reviews.subject: MATH202
reviews.review: I took him for Linear Algebra online (math 231) during pandemic. And now got to take him in person. OH MY GOD, he's somehow even better in person. Math 202 is vector calculus and I don't think he'll teach it again for a while but if he does and ur considering, trust me take him. Even if its for MATH 201 or 151 or 152, or honestly any other class.

reviews.subject: MATH152
reviews.review: His notes can be a mixed bag. Sometimes they are great, other times they are completely useless to what is going to be asked on the test/homework. The textbook is also not the best at times so it can become difficult to grasp certain problems/concepts. His reviews are not good as some topics won't even appear on the test itself. He is ok.

reviews.subject: MATH202
reviews.review: Without a doubt, Zakeri was the greatest lecturer and the best professor that I ever had for a single math class before. He has a gift of being able to simplify the most difficult concepts for everyone, and you can tell that he puts in a lot of effort into his lectures that feel like live TED Talks. If you want to learn AND do well, take him. GOAT

reviews.subject: MATH152
reviews.review: Amazing professor and amazing person. Very humble and never speaks down to anyone. Engaging and inspiring lectures. He really knows how to teach math and it shows. He breaks everything down and his notes are excellent, very clear and concise. Exams are fair and HW is plentiful in order to practice what's taught in class. Study hard and ask Q's.

reviews.subject: MATH231
reviews.review: He is a fair grader. He curved in the moment. I took him for math 231 and 201 in a same time. He curved his both classes. His lectures were clear and explains everything very well.

reviews.subject: CS340
reviews.review:
Took her for a 4-week summer session, and had her both as a lecture professor AND lab.
Unironically, one of the best professors I ever had. She was extremely nice/kind/caring and understanding. Gives a lot of hw but it's worth it. Tons of extra credits. Every topic she mentioned was on the exam. I obviously can't speak for others but she was great.

reviews.subject: MATH152
reviews.review: don't miss class, his notes are crucial for the tests. they are so beyond perfect. he moves from one topic to the next so gracefully. curved the final grades generously for us to succeed. his reviews are his exams just different numbers. the final was the hardest but study kernel and range when you get to it!! he encourages questions so ask them!!

reviews.subject: MATH202
reviews.review: Without a doubt, Zakeri was the greatest lecturer and the best professor that I ever had for a single math class before. He has a gift of being able to simplify the most difficult concepts for everyone, and you can tell that he puts in a lot of effort into his lectures that feel like live TED Talks. If you want to learn AND do well, take him. GOAT

reviews.subject: MATH202
reviews.review: I took him for Linear Algebra online (math 231) during pandemic. And now got to take him in person. OH MY GOD, he's somehow even better in person. Math 202 is vector calculus and I don't think he'll teach it again for a while but if he does and ur considering, trust me take him. Even if its for MATH 201 or 151 or 152, or honestly any other class.

reviews.subject: MATH231
reviews.review: He is an OK professor. Definitely not all that like these other reviews are saying. That being said he is an amazing lecturer and makes most if not all of the calculus 2 concepts easy to understand. Yes, his exams are similar to the review sheet, HOWEVER, he gives little to no partial credit (at least to me). Best math professor QC has.

one of the hardest teachers at QC. she does not GAF, she will just keep going. I liked her though because she was available at office hours, but she is super harsh sometimes, and her tests are brutal (her curve is like 5 points too). don't take if you want an easy A because it won't happen. but the curve at the end of the semester slaps like crazy.

reviews.subject: CSCI340
reviews.review: She is most terrible prof i ever had in my LIFE!!!. SHE was giving attitude to students that she will not repeat what she said while few students didn't understand what she said in her thick accent. IDK why she still a prof. SHE IS NOT HELPFUL AT ALL. SHE DOES NOT CARE HOW HARD u try she will regardless fail u if u don't get grades.

reviews.subject: CSCI343
reviews.review: Took her in the spring for 340 and had to drop it. Thought she was bad, when it was really on me. Having 343 in the summer gave me more time to focus. The first half was more difficult than the second. Do the extra credit, it helps your understanding and your grade. She also tells you exactly what will be on the exams. That helped me ace the final.

reviews.subject: CS343
reviews.review: i basically lost my job because of her, and my future. hope she gets her karma back one day

reviews.subject: CS340
reviews.review: Prof, give my money back. You don't deserve a single cent from anyone. Instead, you should be paying students for registering for your class. You should be ashamed of yourself for ruining students' futures, time, and money. If you have even the smallest amount of morality, quit your job and release all the CS students from this torment.

Professor Fluture's teaching approach is deeply problematic and detrimental to students' learning. Her demeaning behavior, including calling students slow, stupid, or screw-ups, creates a hostile environment that undermines confidence and discourages learning. Do not take if you do not have a strong background in CS.

reviews.subject: CSCI343
reviews.review:
You get what you put in.  I emailed her almost daily asking random questions and by midterm she knew me and definitely graded my exam less harshly. 

Final was price of cake.  She is better option than others for 340 but I wouldn't rdcommend taking this class in summer

reviews.subject: CS343
reviews.review: i basically lost my job because of her, and my future. hope she gets her karma back one day

reviews.subject: CS340
reviews.review: No future with Fluture!!!

reviews.review: She is awesome

reviews.subject: CS340
reviews.review: She was sick most of my semester and emailed a few hours before class to cancel. Sometimes no email. She was out for 1 month. After she got back, the pace of the class picked up a lot. It was difficult to follow along in the class because she gears off to stories. Old lectures on bb it was easier to follow. Tests = all passed quizzes.

reviews.subject: CSXXX
reviews.review: Prof. Smith is kind, caring, fair, responds quickly to emails, and teaches well. Make sure you're comfortable with Java if taking 313 (review labs & old projects). If you show up to class, PARTICIPATE, do all assignments, and study, you'll pass. Grade consisted of quizzes, 3 part Java project, final, and zybooks hw.

reviews.review: She was sick most of my semester and emailed a few hours before class to cancel. Sometimes no email. She was out for 1 month. After she got back, the pace of the class picked up a lot. It was difficult to follow along in the class because she gears off to stories. Old lectures on bb it was easier to follow. Tests = all passed quizzes.

reviews.subject: CSCI343
reviews.review: She is awesome

reviews.subject: CSCI343
reviews.review: I took 340course during the summer session. The workload was heavy,with 2 quizzes, 2 projects,and a final. Many students, including myself, found it challenging to keep up, and nearly 50% of the class dropped after the 1 mid.Her teaching style wasn't very engaging, as her voice tended to be monotonic, and her accent made it hard to follow at times

reviews.subject: CSCI343
reviews.review: The exams were quite difficult, and I felt that the teaching did not adequately prepare us for them. Additionally, she seemed unapproachable and sometimes rude.When students asked questions, she would occasionally respond harshly, which made it uncomfortable to seek help.Overall,I wouldn't recommend this professor. Don't waste your time and money

reviews.subject: CSCI343
reviews.review: Prof, give my money back. You don't deserve a single cent from anyone. Instead, you should be paying students for registering for your class. You should be ashamed of yourself for ruining students' futures, time, and money. If you have even the smallest amount of morality, quit your job and release all the CS students from this torment.

reviews.subject: CSCI343
reviews.review: If you're considering taking a summer course with Dr. Fluture, think twice. It's true what they say: "no future with Fluture." Her summer session is incredibly difficult, with no room for adjustment. She expects you to learn six months' worth of material in one month, and while it is an accelerated course, she does not make it any easier.
